sentence.text: The Effects of Co-prescription of Pantoprazole on the Clozapine Metabolism.
Polypharmacy including somatic medications such as proton pump inhibitors is a common phenomenon in psychiatric care
The aim of this study was to evaluate the pantoprazole effects on clozapine metabolism
A large therapeutic drug-monitoring database containing plasma concentrations of CLZ was analyzed
The results were stratified into four groups: a non-smoking (n=250) and a smoking group (n=326), and two groups co-medicated with pantoprazole: non-smokers (n=26) and smokers (n=29)
The analysis was based on the non-parametrical Mann-Whitney U test (M-W-U) with a significance level of 0
Differences reached statistical significance for pharmacokinetic parameters between CLZ monotherapy and co-medication with pantoprazole neither in smokers nor in non-smokers (p>0
In patients with clozapine monotherapy, smokers had a higher daily dosage of CLZ compared to non-smokers (mean dosage 363±181 vs
Adding pantoprazole to an ongoing treatment with clozapine does not alter the metabolism of clozapine to a significant extent
